bug.short_desc: Calc redraw operation locks up badly (case of accidentally selecting two cells, then pasting)
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: =======================
In KDE:
I accidentally selected two cells and pasted some content. Unfortunately I cannot really describe this well because I don't know exactly what happened.
The next thing was that Calc no longer redrew its window (some deadlock in there?) The two cells stayed marked, I closed the window and reopened it, the window displayed the content of whatever was on the desktop at that time (i.e. no redraw)
Clicking on the "close window" top right "X" resulted in Calc displaying the "save file" dialog, but in full black (no widgets or anything).
On a second try I got a correctly drawn save dialog, but the redraw again didn't work. Tried to save by navigating blindly.
Calc then closed.
Restarting Calc again resulted in a non-redrawn window. I am not sure how it is possible to transfer the fubar state across instances?
Restarted again, now it works. Unfortunately the file was not saved, I will have to start over. Oh well!
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): =============================================================
libreoffice-calc-5.1.5.2-1.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: =================
Not reproduced so far
Hmmm.. I notice that I had a "no space left on device" event at that time. That MAY have something to do with it...
Yeah, I guess this is a "ghost" event, root filesystem was full ... all bets are off in that case.

Nope.. happened again when I pasted a table in an .odt document opened in Calligra Words into Calc.
Bam! Redraw lockup.
how about now with 5.1.6.2-1.fc24 is it still causing this problem. There was a number of cut and paste related fixes since the original report, so this may have been fixed by one of them.
